newsitem.title: FRANCE: Bank of France leaves liquidity unchanged at tende.
newsitem.headline: Bank of France leaves liquidity unchanged at tende.

text.p: The Bank of France made no net drain or injection at a securities repurchase tender held on Monday to allocate funds for injection into the money market on Tuesday.
It accepted bids for 42.9 billion francs in new liquidity, the same as the amount leaving the market on Tuesday when a previous pact expires.
The Bank of France said it allocated 13.0 billion francs to bidders offering Treasury bills as collateral, satisfying 3.7 percent of such demand.
It allotted a further 29.9 billion to bidders putting up private paper, satisfying 12.7 percent of this demand.
